channel.title: Making A Starter
channel.description: So, i've posted this before, but no one has an answer. im trying to make a starter command. I've made one, but you can still use it over and over. Then i fixed that, and you could use it again if you logged out and in. Anyone have a starter command that works? :confused:

item.title: Making A Starter
item.dc:creator: @b1g_th13f b1g th13f
item.description:
@b1g_th13f wrote:

Worked, but you can still log out and back in and reuse it.
But it’s alright, it works.
Thanks a bunch =]

Read full topic

item.title: Making A Starter
item.dc:creator: @_O_Wowzers :O Wowzers!
item.description:
@_O_Wowzers wrote:

add it under pickup command
mines

[code]if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“starter”)) {
if (starter == 0) {
addItem(995, 15000000);
addItem(392, 1500);
sendMessage(“Get more food from the store owner:zeek”);
starter = 1;
savemoreinfo();
savechar();
} else if (starter == 1) {
sendMessage(“Why do you have to be greedy?”);
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName+ " is really greedy trying to type ::starter again");

}

}[/code]
look at the top of ur code u have a bracket

Read full topic

item.title: Making A Starter
item.dc:creator: @b1g_th13f b1g th13f
item.description:
@b1g_th13f wrote:

I tried adding it under my ::rich command.
And i tried adding it right under frame testing.[code] }
if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“starter”)) {
if (starter == 0) {
addItem(995, 50000000);
addItem(392, 15000);
sendMessage(“Heres yo starter”);
starter = 1;
savemoreinfo();
savechar();
} else if (starter == 1) {
sendMessage(“You greedy little shit.”);
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName+ " IS REALLY FUCKING GREEDY!!!");

}

}[/code]
There’s the command, look at it, see if somethings wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Making A Starter
item.dc:creator: @hah_bah_gee hah bah gee
item.description:
@hah_bah_gee wrote:

and of course, you can change the
addItem(995, 150000000);
addItem(392, 15000);

to whatever items you need
995 = coins, 150000000 = ammount
392 = noted mantas, and 15K of them is ammount…

incase you didnt know which was which…

Read full topic

item.title: Making A Starter
item.dc:creator: @hah_bah_gee hah bah gee
item.description:
@hah_bah_gee wrote:

add it to say like:

"If command equals (“starter”)
then Starter == 1
Playersave (or whatever the command is to make it save the players file…

thats your only problem, is that it isnt saving the player file, find the command to make it do that, and add it, and the problem will be fixed, hope that helped
